PRIVACY NOTICE PHILIPS SMART AIR PURIFIER

Royal Philips N.V. (“Philips”) strongly beliefs in protecting the privacy of the personal data you share with us. Please read this Privacy Notice carefully as it informs you how Philips uses and protects your personal data and about choices you have about how your personal data is used.

This privacy notice governs your use of the software application Smart Air Purifier App (“Application”) for mobile devices that was created by Philips. The Application measures indoor air particle level as measured by the Philips Smart Air Purifier, lets you control the smart air purifier via the app, and displays outdoor air quality based upon your location. 

The Philips Smart Air Purifier uses Philips VitaShield IPS filtration technology that is proven to act on many of the causes of unhealthy air in the home. Its multi-layer filter system diminishes airborne particles like pollen, PM 2.5, viruses, bacteria, and TVOCs like toluene.

What information does the Application obtain and how is it used?

User Provided Information 

The Application obtains the information you provide when you download and register the Application. Registration with us is optional. However, please keep in mind that you may not be able to use some of the features offered by the Application unless you register with us (for example setting up the Smart Air Purifier or controlling the Smart Air Purifier)

We may contact you for marketing promotions only if we have received your prior consent.

Automatically Collected Information 

In addition, the Application will collect certain information automatically, including

• IP address of your mobile device and purifier

• your mobile operating system

• the mobile device ID

• connection and disconnection timestamps

• firmware version 

• indoor air quality data

We collect this data for research purposes and/or provide you with useful tips, both to improve the performance of the Application and the Air Purifier. 

Does the Application collect precise real time location information of the device?

When you give us your prior explicit consent for using your location data, we may use GPS technology (or other similar technology) to determine your current location in order to determine the city you are located within and display a location map with relevant air quality information and where your smart air purifier(s) is (are) located. In order to provide you with weather data and outdoor air quality data based on your location, the information is shared with third parties. Our agreements with these third parties will limit the purposes for which your personal data can be used and disclosed, and will require your personal data to be adequately safeguarded. We will not sell your Personal Data to third parties for their own purposes. 

If you do not want us to use your location for the purposes set forth above, you should change your privacy setting by turning off the location services for the mobile application located in your account settings within the mobile application. 

Do third parties see and/or have access to information obtained by the Application?

Yes. We will share your information with third parties only in the ways that are described in this privacy notice.

We may disclose User Provided and Automatically Collected Information:

• as required by law, such as to comply with a subpoena, or similar legal process;

• when we believe in good faith that disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, protect your safety or the safety of others, investigate fraud, or respond to a government request;

• with our trusted services providers who work on our behalf, do not have an independent use of the information we disclose to them, and have agreed to adhere to the rules set forth in this privacy notice.

• if Philips is involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of its assets, you will be notified via email and/or a prominent notice on our Website of any change in ownership or uses of this information, as well as any choices you may have regarding this information.

You can stop all collection of information easily by disconnecting the Smart Air Purifier from the internet and uninstalling the Application. You can turn-off the wi-fi function of the Smart Air Purifier and no data will be collected any longer. You may use the standard Application uninstall processes as may be available as part of your mobile device or via the mobile application marketplace or network. 

Data Retention Policy, Managing Your Information

We will retain User Provided data for as long as you use the Application and for a reasonable time thereafter. We will retain Automatically Collected information for up to 1 year and thereafter may store it in aggregate and will be anonymized. If you’d like us to delete User Provided Data that you have provided via the Application, please contact us at privacy@philips.com. Please note that some or all of the User Provided Data may be required in order for the Application to function properly.

 

Children

We do not use the Application to knowingly solicit data from or market to children under the age of 18. If a parent or guardian becomes aware that his or her child has provided us with information without their consent, he or she should contact us at privacy@philips.com. We will delete such information from our files within a reasonable time.

Service Provider

Your personal data is processed on behalf of Philips by a Chinese Service Provider. This means that your data will not be transferred to other countries. Philips has implemented organizational and contractual measures to protect your personal data and to impose the same legal requirements on our service providers, including requirements that your personal data are exclusively processed for the purposes of as mentioned above. If you give your prior consent to use your personal data for Philips marketing promotions we also ask your prior consent to transfer your data out of China to Philips backend IT systems. 

Security

We are concerned about safeguarding the confidentiality of your information. We provide physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards to protect information we process and maintain. For example, we limit access to this information to authorized employees and contractors who need to know that information in order to operate, develop or improve our Application. Please be aware that, although we take appropriate organizational and technical security measures to protect misuse and loss of information we process and maintain, no security system can prevent all potential security breaches.

 

Changes

The services that Philips provides are always evolving and the form and nature of the services that Philips provides may change from time to time without prior notice to you. For this reason, we reserve the right to change or add provisions to this Privacy Notice from time to time. We will notify you of any changes to our Privacy Notice by posting the new Privacy Notice in the App. We encourage you to check back often to review the latest version. 

The new Privacy Notice will be effective upon posting, if you do not agree to the revised notice, you should alter your preferences, or consider stop using the App. The most recent version shall supersede any and all other versions of this Privacy Notice. By continuing to access or make use of our services after those changes become effective, you agree to be bound by the revised Privacy Notice.

Contact us

If you have any questions, complaints or suggestions about this Privacy Notice or your experiences with the App., please contact us at privacy@philips.com
